answers.answer: I just had my last shift this past Saturday at 38weeks. It all depends on how your feeling. I would probably suggest you leave work sooner if that's how you feel.
I'm going until labor... But I completely regret it. I'm 37 weeks and I've called in twice this week, I just feel bad since they already made the schedule for the month.

I wanna try and go to 38 weeks but my mom is worried and thinks I should take it at 37 weeks and I'm a cna for my Nana so showering her is where things get difficult but my relief is ready to come in whenever so I'm really considering it
I worked until 38 but it really varies on the person. I was only sick for a month in the beginning and my belly isn't too big so it was pretty easy for me luckily. Some people really struggle though.
My main problem is the stretching between my legs and all the pressure on my pelvis

I'm 37 weeks and I'm going to talk to my doctor Thursday to see if he can give me a note or something to take off next week. It is a real struggle getting out of the bed in the mornings plus I want to make sure I'm fully prepared (FTM)
I'm working right up to my due date, due in 11 days and next time around I'll probably stop at 38.

I'm taking off when I'm 36 weeks. I have a very lenient job and someone will fill in for me for two months. I figure since my work is so willing to work with me I might as well make the most of it. I also have gestational diabetes so baby could come early.

question: When are you all taking yours? I was gonna take it when I hit 39 weeks but I've been in so much pain and have a hard time walking and bending over I've been thinking about taking it sooner.
title: maternity leave
